content:
IJSVsaEngine Interface

In this Article

Defines the methods and properties that a script engine must support and provides programmatic access to the script engine.

Syntax

Declaration

[System.Obsolete("Use of this type is not recommended because it is being deprecated in Visual Studio 2005; there will be no replacement for this feature. Please see the ICodeCompiler documentation for additional help.")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComVisible(true)]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.Guid("8FA2C97B-47E4-4A31-A7F5-FF39D1195CD9")]
[System.Runtime.InteropServices.InterfaceType(System.Runtime.InteropServices.ComInterfaceType.InterfaceIsIUnknown)]
public interface IJSVsaEngine

Properties summary

Assembly

Gets a reference to the running assembly generated by Run method.
Evidence

Provides evidence for the purpose of validating the current object's identity.
GenerateDebugInfo

Sets or gets a Boolean value that signifies whether the script engine produces debug information when the Compile method is called.
IsCompiled

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the source is compiled.
IsDirty

Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current in-memory representation of the item differs from the persisted representation.
IsRunning

Gets a Boolean value that reports whether the script engine is currently in run mode.
Items

Gets the collection of IJSVsaItem objects, which represent all items added to the script engine.
Language

Gets the name of the programming language supported by the script engine.
LCID

Gets or sets the geographical locale and language in which to report exception messages.
Name

Sets or gets the display name of the script engine.
RootMoniker

Sets or gets a script engine's root moniker.
RootNamespace

Sets or gets the root namespace used by the script engine.
Site

Sets or gets the host-implemented IJSVsaSite object that is used by the script engine to communicate with the host.
Version

Gets the current version of the language compiler supported by the script engine, in the form Major.Minor.Revision.Build.

Methods summary

Close()

Closes the engine.
Compile()

Causes the engine to compile the existing source state.
GetOption(String)

Gets implementation-specific options for the engine.
InitNew()

Provides a notification that the initialization phase is complete.
IsValidIdentifier(String)

Checks whether the supplied identifier is valid for the engine.
LoadSourceState(IJSVsaPersistSite)

Directs the engine to load source items from their point of persistence, as specified by the host-provided object.
Reset()

Removes the script engine from the running state and disconnects automatically bound event handlers.
RevokeCache()

Invalidates the cached assembly for the engine, as specified by its root moniker.
Run()

Initiates execution of compiled code in the script engine and binds all event handlers.
SaveCompiledState(Byte[],Byte[])

Saves the compiled state of the script engine; optionally, it also saves debugging information.
SaveSourceState(IJSVsaPersistSite)

Directs the script engine to persist its source state.
SetOption(String,Object)

Sets implementation-specific options for a script engine.

Properties

  • Assembly

    Gets a reference to the running assembly generated by Run method.

    public System.Reflection.Assembly Assembly { get; }

    Property Value

    • Assembly

      Reference to the currently running assembly.

  • Evidence

    Provides evidence for the purpose of validating the current object's identity.

    public System.Security.Policy.Evidence Evidence { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Evidence

      Returns a reference to an Evidence object.

  • GenerateDebugInfo

    Sets or gets a Boolean value that signifies whether the script engine produces debug information when the Compile method is called.

    public bool GenerateDebugInfo { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true to produce debug information; otherwise, false.

  • IsCompiled

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the source is compiled.

    public bool IsCompiled { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the source is compiled; otherwise, false.

  • IsDirty

    Gets or sets a value that indicates whether the current in-memory representation of the item differs from the persisted representation.

    public bool IsDirty { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the in-memory representation differs from the persisted representation; otherwise, false.

  • IsRunning

    Gets a Boolean value that reports whether the script engine is currently in run mode.

    public bool IsRunning { get; }

    Property Value

    • Boolean

      true if the engine is in run mode; otherwise, false.

  • Items

    Gets the collection of IJSVsaItem objects, which represent all items added to the script engine.

    public Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.IJSVsaItems Items { get; }

    Property Value

    • IJSVsaItems

      The collection of items.

  • Language

    Gets the name of the programming language supported by the script engine.

    public string Language { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the programming language.

  • LCID

    Gets or sets the geographical locale and language in which to report exception messages.

    public int LCID { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • Int32

      An integer value representing the locale in which exception messages are to be reported.

  • Name

    Sets or gets the display name of the script engine.

    public string Name { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The name of the engine.

  • RootMoniker

    Sets or gets a script engine's root moniker.

    public string RootMoniker { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The root moniker of the engine.

  • RootNamespace

    Sets or gets the root namespace used by the script engine.

    public string RootNamespace { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The namespace of the engine.

  • Site

    Sets or gets the host-implemented IJSVsaSite object that is used by the script engine to communicate with the host.

    public Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.IJSVsaSite Site { get; set; }

    Property Value

    • IJSVsaSite

      The host-implemented object.

  • Version

    Gets the current version of the language compiler supported by the script engine, in the form Major.Minor.Revision.Build.

    public string Version { get; }

    Property Value

    • String

      The current version.

Methods

  • Close()

    Closes the engine.

    public void Close ();
  • Compile()

    Causes the engine to compile the existing source state.

    public bool Compile ();

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true on successful compilation; otherwise, false.

  • GetOption(String)

    Gets implementation-specific options for the engine.

    public object GetOption (string name);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the option to get.

    Returns

    • Object

      The value of the option.

  • InitNew()

    Provides a notification that the initialization phase is complete.

    public void InitNew ();
  • IsValidIdentifier(String)

    Checks whether the supplied identifier is valid for the engine.

    public bool IsValidIdentifier (string identifier);

    Parameters

    • identifier
      String

      A string value provided as identifier.

    Returns

    • Boolean

      true if the identifier is valid; otherwise, it returns false.

  • LoadSourceState(IJSVsaPersistSite)

    Directs the engine to load source items from their point of persistence, as specified by the host-provided object.

    public void LoadSourceState (Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.IJSVsaPersistSite site);

    Parameters

    • site
      IJSVsaPersistSite

      The site from which the specified source items is loaded.

  • Reset()

    Removes the script engine from the running state and disconnects automatically bound event handlers.

    public void Reset ();
  • RevokeCache()

    Invalidates the cached assembly for the engine, as specified by its root moniker.

    public void RevokeCache ();
  • Run()

    Initiates execution of compiled code in the script engine and binds all event handlers.

    public void Run ();
  • SaveCompiledState(Byte[],Byte[])

    Saves the compiled state of the script engine; optionally, it also saves debugging information.

    public void SaveCompiledState (out byte[] pe, out byte[] pdb);

    Parameters

    • pe
      Byte[]

      The compiled state of the script engine.

    • pdb
      Byte[]

      Specifies debugging information contained in the .PDB file corresponding to the PE (portable executable).

  • SaveSourceState(IJSVsaPersistSite)

    Directs the script engine to persist its source state.

    public void SaveSourceState (Microsoft.JScript.Vsa.IJSVsaPersistSite site);

    Parameters

    • site
      IJSVsaPersistSite

      The site to which source state is saved.

  • SetOption(String,Object)

    Sets implementation-specific options for a script engine.

    public void SetOption (string name, object value);

    Parameters

    • name
      String

      The name of the option to set.

    • value
      Object

      The value for the option being set.
